resources.string: Welcome to the Enigma in Android. This is the version 0.0.3 Enigma Android Simulator created by Jay Cao.\nThe link of the project repo is available in the bottom line of this app.

Welcome to the Enigma in Android.
Here are some useful tips for you: You can choose a specific rotor from the given rotors for each of the five slots. (i.e., choose an item from each drop-down box below `Setting`) Then you can choose to give a more detailed setting by typing in the line of `IPs, ARs and plugboard.` Note that IPs stands for initial positions while ARs stands for alphabet rings. If you do not want to make the settings more complex, just ignore that line.

After you finish the settings, you can type your messages (any characters from the 26 English letters in either upper case or lower case) in the first frame with green border. Then, simply press `ENCODE`, and the encoded message will be shown in the second green-border frame.
The last tip, you can press the encoded messages to copy them into your clipboard.
